intro: Micropholis rugosa, commonly known as the rough micropholis, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its rough, hairy stems and leaves that are often lobed or serrated. Its flowers are small and typically white or pale yellow, arranged in clusters. Micropholis rugosa is often found in rocky or disturbed habitats and is adapted to dry conditions.
